1273: :label: proof-thm-stage0-complete
1274: 
1275: We establish the three statements through direct KL entropy production analysis.
1276: 
1277: **Framework Setup**: Let $\rho \in L^1_+(\Omega)$ be the unnormalized density with $\|\rho\| = \int_\Omega \rho \, dxdv \le 1$. The KL-divergence for unnormalized densities is $D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \pi) = \int_\Omega \rho \log(\rho/\pi) \, dxdv$, which decomposes as:
1278: 
1279: $$
1280: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \pi) = \|\rho\| D_{\text{KL}}(\tilde{\rho} \| \pi) + \|\rho\| \log \|\rho\|
1281: 
1282: $$
1283: 
1284: where $\tilde{\rho} = \rho/\|\rho\|$ is the normalized density.
1285: 
1286: **Statement 1: Revival is KL-expansive**
1287: 
1288: The revival operator acts as $\mathcal{L}_{\text{revival}}[\rho] = \lambda_{\text{revive}} m_d \rho/\|\rho\|$ where $m_d = 1 - \|\rho\|$ is the dead mass. Using the Gateaux derivative formula for KL-divergence:
1289: 
1290: $$
1291: \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \pi)\bigg|_{\text{revival}} = \int_\Omega \mathcal{L}_{\text{revival}}[\rho] \left(\log \frac{\rho}{\pi} + 1\right) dx dv
1292: 
1293: $$
1294: 
1295: Substituting the revival operator:
1296: 
1297: $$
1298: = \int_\Omega \lambda_{\text{revive}} m_d \frac{\rho}{\|\rho\|} \left(\log \frac{\rho}{\pi} + 1\right) dx dv = \lambda_{\text{revive}} m_d \int_\Omega \tilde{\rho} \left(\log \frac{\rho}{\pi} + 1\right) dx dv
1299: 
1300: $$
1301: 
1302: Since $\int_\Omega \tilde{\rho} \, dxdv = 1$ (normalization), we have:
1303: 
1304: $$
1305: \int_\Omega \tilde{\rho} \cdot 1 \, dxdv = 1
1306: 
1307: $$
1308: 
1309: And using $\log(\rho/\pi) = \log \tilde{\rho} + \log \|\rho\| - \log \pi$:
1310: 
1311: $$
1312: \int_\Omega \tilde{\rho} \log \frac{\rho}{\pi} \, dxdv = D_{\text{KL}}(\tilde{\rho} \| \pi) + \log \|\rho\|
1313: 
1314: $$
1315: 
1316: Combining:
1317: 
1318: $$
1319: \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}\bigg|_{\text{revival}} = \lambda_{\text{revive}} m_d \left(D_{\text{KL}}(\tilde{\rho} \| \pi) + \log \|\rho\| + 1\right) = \lambda_{\text{revive}} m_d \left(1 + \frac{D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \pi)}{\|\rho\|}\right)
1320: 
1321: $$
1322: 
1323: Since $D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \pi) \ge 0$ with equality iff $\rho = \|\rho\| \pi$, we have the entropy production is strictly positive for all $\rho \not\propto \pi$ when $m_d > 0$.
1324: 
1325: **Statement 2: Joint jump not contractive**
1326: 
1327: The joint jump operator combines killing and revival: $\mathcal{L}_{\text{jump}} = -\kappa_{\text{kill}}(x)\rho + \lambda_{\text{revive}} m_d \rho/\|\rho\|$. The killing contribution is:
1328: 
1329: $$
1330: \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}\bigg|_{\text{killing}} = -\int_\Omega \kappa_{\text{kill}}(x) \rho \left(\log \frac{\rho}{\pi} + 1\right) dx dv
1331: 
1332: $$
1333: 
1334: This is negative (contractive) when $\log(\rho/\pi) > -1$, but can be positive otherwise. The joint entropy production $\frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}|_{\text{jump}}$ combines killing (potentially contractive) and revival (always expansive), with sign depending on $\|\rho\|$. Therefore, it is not unconditionally contractive.
1335: 
1336: **Statement 3: Kinetic dominance necessity**
1337: 
1338: From the generator decomposition $\mathcal{L} = \mathcal{L}_{\text{kin}} + \mathcal{L}_{\text{jump}}$ and Statement 1, the jump operator contributes positive entropy production. For exponential KL-convergence $D_{\text{KL}}(\rho(t) \| \pi) \to 0$, we require:
1339: 
1340: $$
1341: \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \pi) = \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}\bigg|_{\text{kin}} + \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}\bigg|_{\text{jump}} < 0
1342: 
1343: $$
1344: 
1345: Since the jump term is positive (expansive), this necessitates:
1346: 
1347: $$
1348: \left|\frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}\bigg|_{\text{kin}}\right| > \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}\bigg|_{\text{jump}}
1349: 
1350: $$
1351:
